channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What's happening with furniture prices? A tale of $399 couches and tariffs
item.description: Competition, whether from overseas rivals or second-hand goods, has kept the price of furniture relatively low. New tariffs may boost U.S. makers — an...

item.title: FAA to reduce air traffic by 10%. And, Trump administration plans to appeal SNAP ruling
item.description: The FAA plans to reduce air traffic by 10% at busy airports. And, a federal judge orders the Trump administration to fully restore SNAP food benefits ...

item.title: Under RFK Jr., the CDC is scrutinizing the childhood vaccine schedule
item.description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has launched an unprecedented review of routine shots given to kid...

item.title: The shutdown continues, but politics persists. That gives this quiz a lot of fodder
item.description: Here are a bunch of questions about politics and one about bears.

item.title: Why next year's flu shot might not be as good as it should be
item.description: America's withdrawal from the World Health Organization is affecting the ability of U.S. scientists to track flu and other pathogens. That could be a ...

item.title: Senate readies key vote on new approach to end shutdown
item.description: The government shutdown is now on Day 38 as the Senate prepares to vote again, but bipartisan progress has appeared to stall. Follow live updates here...

item.title: House Democrats ask former Prince Andrew to take questions about Epstein
item.description: Democrats on the House Oversight Committee want King Charles' younger brother Andrew to undergo "a transcribed interview" about Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Trump administration seeks to halt SNAP food aid payments after a court order
FAA order cutting thousands of flights kicks in as airlines scramble to comply
item.description: The FAA ordered airlines to cut thousands of flights as the agency deals with air traffic controller shortages during the government shutdown. The cut...

item.title: Multiple people fall ill after package delivered to Air Force One base
item.description: The building the package was opened in was evacuated and those taken ill were found to be stable.

item.title: Man discovers gold worth $800,000 buried in his garden
item.description: The man informed the local authorities after he made the discovery, and they allowed him to keep the gold.

item.title: Vaccine Court | Sunday on 60 Minutes
item.description: If you’ve never heard of the national vaccine court, you’re not alone. It’s paid out billions to Americans who have suffered rare injuries after vacci...

item.title: Crews are working to fix Alaska Native villages devastated by flooding. But will residents return?
Travelers face cancellations and frustration as the FAA orders flight cuts due to the shutdown
item.description: The Federal Aviation Administration’s order to scale back flights nationwide because of the government shutdown is now in effect.

item.title: Elon Musk's $1tn pay deal approved by Tesla shareholders
item.description: The richest man in the world will get hundreds of millions of new shares if he hits his targets.

item.title: Kenya demands safety for its citizens after Tanzania's post-poll crackdown
item.description: Some Kenyans have reportedly been killed, injured and others detained by Tanzanian security officers.

item.title: More than 50 people injured in mosque blast at Jakarta high school
item.description: Authorities say a 17-year-old suspected of causing the explosion during Friday prayers is in surgery.

item.title: China launches new aircraft carrier in naval race with the US
item.description: The Fujian uses electromagnetic catapults that allow planes to strike from a greater distance.
